H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H7588.def: = process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise

H3121.def: = wet soil; ◄ moistened because of its proximity to water; ≈ regarded as an obstacle for movement

H2916.def: = wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H838.def: literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H2319.def: = state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4009.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7750.def: = humans that depart from the right pattern of behavior

H3577.def: = state in which something that has been said is not truthful

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H6105.def: = state in which humans are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H4503.def: = objects given to a person of high status; ► sometimes this is done on a voluntary basis as a show of respect for the recipient and in order to win that person's favor; in other cases this is done to fulfill the requirements imposed by the recipient

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H2401.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H4039.def: = long strip of writing material made by sewing together sheets of papyrus or parchment; this strip was then rolled up from one end or from both ends to form one or two cylinders; usually the ends of the scroll were attached to sticks, around which the scroll was rolled; an unrolled scroll was often about 10 meters in length and stood approximately 23-25 centimeters high; the term מְגִלַּת־סֵפֶר seems to be the more complete term for a book scroll, as it occurs at the beginning of passages in which scrolls play a roll; the shorter term מְגִלָּה is used after that

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

H1319.def: = action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3607.def: = causative action by which humans hold other humans under control, either in a prison or in another situation in which that person does not have the freedom to act and go at will

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H8668.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need

H3582.def: = state in which humans are unaware of certain information

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3607.def: = causative action by which humans hold other humans under control, either in a prison or in another situation in which that person does not have the freedom to act and go at will

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H661.def: = state in which someone is surrounded on all sides

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6105.def: = state in which humans are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H8185.def: = the fine thread-like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals; ≈ one single strand can be used as a symbol for a very small distance or quantity, whereas the collective of strands often symbolizes a great quantity

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H2363.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H2659.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H2655.def: = state in which humans are emotionally attached to deities

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H7797.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H8668.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H6403.def: = process by which humans find safety from a dangerous or life-threatening situation

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H309.def: = process by which an event happens later than expected
